comment: She's a passionate and engaging professor, but other than that I wouldn't recommend taking her class unless you are willing to spend most of your time studying. The course load is very heavy She is a tough grader and moves at a fast pace. Attendance is a big thing in her class she will expect you to be punctual if not your grade will suffer.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Assignments due @5pm.Lectures cover 1/4 of what you are expected to know for assessment, meaning you will be assigned hours of reading and taking notes on videos outside of class to succeed. The work she expects us to do outside of class is more than I am expected to do or need to do to succeed in my 3 other classes combined. That's not all, folks.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: For History majors, it's about what you'd expect, but for anyone else Prof Way is a complete pain. Lectures that are never finished in class, tests & quizzes that cover any material that was even mention in passing (or never brought up in class at all), and overall just a difficult person to work with. Stay as far away as you can.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Engaging lectures, difficult exams. No laptops or phones allowed in class (not harshly enforced but not doing at least the latter would lock you out of bonus points, and you will need them!). Not a bad professor, but a difficult one if you aren't willing to adapt to her teaching style. Take good notes, study, and you will do great. Use quizlets!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: She's a sweet person, but the class was ridiculous. She didn't grade anything until the last week of the semester, and the work load was insane. I studied hard for the tests, and would average a B. Make sure to get the textbook, as the class is really short and most lectures would go unfinished. I really wanted to like this class, but its a lot.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: The assignments given are textbook and lecture-heavy but do not correlate with the material covered in class. The professor does not review the textbook and grades harshly. There is also a lot of homework to complete. The class notes provided are incomplete, making it difficult to review the material.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She's sweet but- DO NOT TAKE HER. Never finishes lectures, so you miss info that will be on exams. 10+ hrs a week studying & writing mandatory flashcards & still won't feel caught up. Impossible to finish in-class exams that are 50+ questions & 6 harshly graded essay responses. Never puts grades in & is overall a very difficult professor. STAY AWAY
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: While she is a very kind person, Dr. Way is by no means a professor that I would recommend to anyone who is not a history major. She seems to forget that a majority of us are only taking her class because it is required. Her grading system is obscenely harsh, she seems disorganized 99% of the time, and overall this class should NOT be this hard.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Shes sweet as can be, but her class is horribly difficult. Ive been a straight A student all my life and couldnt get anywhere near an A in this class. The tests hardly cover anything in the books or lectures, and she did not accommodate to absences and let you make up work (even when she encouraged you to stay home at times of being sick).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: She was very kind, but not understanding about missing work due to serious reasons. There were a lot of quick writes that were due each week and she made sure that you read the textbook and listened to lectures in order to do well on them. Very textbook heavy. Assigns a lot of work, but this is helpful for studying for tests.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Not at all understanding to students during the pandemic. Very textbook-heavy course, and she basically copies exactly what's in the textbook over into her lectures and puts her own twist on it, so take that as you will. Incredibly unresponsive as well, it took her two weeks to get back to me at one point. AVOID THIS CLASS.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I had to take this class online because of everything going on and I seriously regret it. There was so many assignments and quizzes each week. Her syllabus said 3-4 assignments and there would be close to 20. Someone had her on campus and they said there wasnt nearly as much work. The lectures and readings didnt cover what was on the test. Avoid.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Solid choice. I took her my first semester of my first year. She lectured every class but they were informative and worth your time. She had an extra credit opportunity where if you turned your phone in during class, you got 1 extra credit point on a test each day you turned it in. I got bumped up a whole letter grade on 2 tests because of it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Amazing lectures

comment: Lectures every class. A few tests before every exam. Shes straight forward and a good professor. Sadly she does some group projects.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: Run if you can. Lots of stupid busy work for homework and mediocre lectures. Tests were so hard and did not cover anything she went over in class. Group Activities and she will call you out in a heart beat to speak. AVOID

Interesting lectures, but they were way too specific. There were so many details I found myself going home and reading the entire textbook just to keep up. Her exams very much reflected this. I made a 90 on the first which was the highest grade in the class. It went downhill from there. She also pushed certain agendas and did not like disagreement.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Incredibly stiff when talking, everything was read straight from a paper and was just overall awful. People were leaving the first day before class even ended. This professor also embodies the stereotype i had never met before of " social justice warrior liberal college professor". not a fit for history that needs to be matter of fact.

History has always been one of my absolute favorite subjects, but this will go down as one of my least favorite classes. She always seemed to be making things unnecessary difficult. Good students tend to struggle throughout the semester and end up with a B at best. Shes also unforgiving attendance-wise, so try not to get sick or have emergencies.

worst teacher ive ever had. im a straight A student and i barley passed her tests. Her tests are 40 multiple choice questions and 3 short answer questions in 50 minutes which she grades SO HARD and each short answer question involves like 7 more questions. She expects us to have time to write all of that and have so much memorized. DO NOT TAKE!!!!!
rating_tags: Test heavy--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Boring class but her dry humor makes it somewhat enjoyable. Tests are super hard but she gives a lot of opportunities for extra credit. I never really used her notes to study because they weren't in depth enough for me but if you read the textbook you should be fine, and her lectures are good.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Doesnt give in depth notes, shows incomplete/confusing PowerPoint slides when lecturing so note taking is very difficult
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: She is very decent for a history professor. She is very enthusiastic about her lectures which makes them bearable. She gives a lot of extra credit opportunities. She is not very tech-savvy, so let her know if she did not post an assignment online or made any mistakes. The tests are open response heavy.
rating_tags: Inspirational--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She is a terrible teacher. Tests are extremely hard especially short answers. The test have stuff we have never covered in class. I love history and I am good at it, but she made it way harder than it shouldve been.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This professor is super nice and sweet. She has decent lectures, but they do not match up with the exam. Her exams are terrible. She does not give you enough time. There are three exams and they do not count for the same percentage. Take her but beware of her exams.

Really enjoyed Professor Way. Difficult part was amount of content in the course. So much information to keep up with! Prof. Way was engaging and made material interesting. 1 mini Exam at start of semester. DO NOT underestimate this exam. Study for it.. you'll thank yourself later. Then Test 2, 3, and Final. Read the book and do your key terms
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Tests are tough--Would take again

comment: Dr. Way is a very nice lady, but ultimately a difficult teacher. Her classes are 75 minute lectures with PowerPoint slides of a single bullet point. Something not covered in class? Yep- still on the test. She requires a lot of short answer that typically use the 5-W method of answering (very formulaic, more recall than analysis or application).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The class required you to work but for an 8 A.M. summer class, it was enjoyable. She's a great lady with lots of energy and I would love to take another class from her.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: she is really funny, passionate, knowledgeable. way too much reading though: the textbook + 3 novels. essay question tests, a bunch of quizzes, three book response essays. she is willing to work with the class though. overall easy tests and material. brought us donuts one day. i got an A and barely tried. tons of extra credit for not using ur phone
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: DO NOT TAKE!!! I'm a straight A student who barely passed her class. Even if you do all the reading and go to every class, her exams are worded weird and impossible to pass. I don't know a single person w/ an A. Reading, writing assignments, lots of quizzes all count for 25% of grade and 3 exams make up the rest. Absolutely awful class!!!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Prof. Way is an excellent person and if she were my neighbor she'd be my best friend. Her as a professor, not so much. She is very opinionated and relies solely on a strictly bullet-pointed PowerPoint. You have to be in class to take the notes she says bc looking at the power points at home is useless. Tests are hard even without the short answer.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Did not like her. Made everything harder than it had to be. A lot of quizzes. She's also very biased and opinionated. If your an A student you'll get a B. Not one person on my class has an A. If you have to work to get a B or C defitnelty do not take her. She does offer extra credit however. All in all do not take her.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Way is okay, and that's it. Her tests are essay tests, even though she says short answer. If you do take her, don't take a class immediately after because she goes over time often. Decent extra credit opportunities. If you're looking for an easy A, don't take her.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I really enjoyed Professor Holliman's class. Her exams weren't difficult, and as long as you do the reading and take the quizzes, getting an A shouldn't be that difficult.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Knows what she is talking about and loves her subjects. If youre a history person,  youd like her. Tests were hard, pay attention to key terms and read the book. SHe has in class writing assignments taken for a grade, 2 tests, and a final. She wasnt awful but she makes you work for the grade.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Although there are a lot of papers and assignments due, she gives clear guidelines and also really great feedback. There is a lot of textbook reading as well as outside movies that are necessary to pass. In class, there are only lectures, and her slides don't have information because she discusses it in class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: DO NOT TAKE HER. It is extremely hard to make an A and she requires a ton of reading. There is a quiz almost every week. Don't let her niceness fool you.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I wonder if she knows how she's perceived by a majority of her students. She's rude, highly opinionated  and pushes those views slyly through lectures. Unorganized. Poor time management skills. Treats you like you're a child. Her class was a mistake. And I took it for honors credit. Constantly goes over time. AVOID. THIS CLASS IS A HOT MESS.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: You have to read the textbook to do well on tests. All quizzes are online, she replaces your lowest quiz score with the syllabus quiz. There are only 2 tests, multiple choice and short answer. The final is all multiple choice but is cumulative. Her lectures are  interesting but she will have readings and tedious classwork. I liked her a lot.

There's a lot of reading. At some point, we had to read 30 pages. There are only 2 exams and 1 final, so you have to do well on the 2 exams. There are a lot of quizzes, but they're online, and she drops the two lowest quiz grades. Her lectures are really long and take up the whole class, so don't expect to leave early except on test days.

Dr. HollimanWay is a great teacher in my opinion, although many did not think so in my class! Lots of extra credit on tests,I got a 76 but getting all the random extra questions right, she gave me a 91. No homework really,3 tests and her multiple choice is very tough. Tough grader in general. Got an 89,41 but did not raise to an A, left a bad taste

Don't take this class if you want to pass history 2112. her lectures have nothing to do with the tests.  She assigns quizzes on subjects before she even lectures on the subject. this class is the worst class ever.

Avoid this professor at all cost. She lectures from the beginning of class until 10 minutes after we should be released. Attendance is mandatory and for ever absence after 5 she takes five points from your final grade. Lectures literally have nothing to do with the tests and you have to do 6 essay questions along with the multiple choice section.

Not an easy professor. I escaped with an A only by extensively studying. Tests are hard. Lectures are almost irrelevant to the test. She provides key terms lists, those are what's on the test. Never lets out early.  When this professor says that there will be "short answer" questions on the test, she really means "page-long short essays".

Well educated professor & loves her stuff, but absolutely the worst class I've ever taken. So much reading, weekly online quizzes, long lectures. Lectures provide a lot of information, but nothing she teaches you corresponds with the tests. My advice is avoid her 100% of the time. If you take her class, just hope for the best. She is hard!

If you actually care about learning history, Dr. Holliman-Way is a great professor to take. Makes the material easy to understand, just requires you to know ALL of it. She wants you to succeed and is willing to help if you're willing to put in the effort. Don't take her if you're looking to just fulfill a credit.

TAKE THIS AS A MAYMESTER! The others reviews seem critical, but I took this class as a maymester and she was so helpful! The tests were all multiple choice with NO essays because it's only 9 days! She keeps it interesting and gives you enough breaks to keep you going. She was super helpful and always made sure everyone understood.

Harsh and inconsistent grading. Short answer tests are very difficult and are graded on her opinion. The bonus questions will save you. Lectures are boring and have a heavy liberal bias. 3-4 page essays about four different books. She drops 1. Quizzes are somewhat easy and online. She drops 2. It is extremely difficult to get an A, but possible.

I got an A and I wouldn't even suggest taking her. Really snarky and kinda passive-aggressive. Never posted paper topics in a timely manner and always stressed everyone out. The final was SO. MUCH. INFO. She's smart, but she acts like everyone in the class is a history major (I was in honors, btw). Her Reagan-bashing bugged me, too. Pass.

Do not take the class. she hasn't updated anything, still using old materials. she has a final review online but its from like 3 years ago so that was useless. you have to be in class on time or she will take points off your grade, just Avoid her at all cost
Very nice. Each test's methods are different. Syllabus pgs were all wrong, hard grader.

AVOID@ ALL COSTS:Mostly nice personTerrible professor! Uses old materialhasn't updated testsquizzes for new book being used. Inflexibleobdurate. Strangeunhealthy hatred of Reagan made her seem crazy. Flips outmoody@ students.  Teaches as HS class. Class  constantly way off topic. Test essay ?'s open to her interpretationINCONSISTENT GRADING.
Seriously if you want to get an A do not take her.She always had us do a bunch of work,pop quizzes,and she gets off topic a lot. I do not recommend!

DO NOT TAKE HER!!! Worst professor ever and hardly helps. No curves and thinks a B is good enough. If you want an A, pass. Too much reading, videos, and power points. Bad professor. You teach yourself. Quizzes and test cover new content. She misses out on major/important events in history. HS teachers were much better:(

A TON OF READING! Gives online quizzed before topics are even taught. There are only 2 tests and a final with no curves/drops. Very hard to get a A-B on the tests. I got a 79 on the first test and an 82 on the second with hard core studying. The final was a killer because it was 75% new material and 25% old. Do not take if you want an A

Worst professor. You read nearly 30 pages each night.What you learn in class and what you teach yourself doesn't prepare you for tests. She teaches from another book that we dont use. She puts bonuses on test, but you won't know half the answers. I loved history and got a good grade but her class takes time away from other classes. Lectures BORING.

Toooooo much reading!!!!!!!!!!!! Then you have a quiz almost every other day the study guide is a bunch of key terms and you must know more than just the definition so for her test you need to study the power points your notes the book and a list of key terms that she sometimes doesn't get to go over in class so you have to teach yourself

Horrible! i was miserable 1 week prior to the 2 tests and final. each cover about 150 pgs of text. she doesnt prepare you at all on what to study. she only gives a list of about 150 key terms which you must learn (who what when where why and significance) of each term! after miserably learning all these i found myself only knowing 30% of the test!

Dr. Way's lectures are interesting. You will be given quizzes on readings each week. It is easier to print powerpoint lecture to make notes. Tests are multiple choice and essay. You will need to give as much info on the essay questions to get full credit. The final was overwhelming! If you take her, prepare to read & put in effort for an A or B.

She is really nice, a little quirky, and has good information. She works off powerpoints everyday in lecture, and works with a lot of textbook and online reading. Tests are multiple choice with a big short answer section that saved my grades. Online quizzes are difficult if you don't do her readings. Overall very straightforward and a good teacher.

Super sweet and very clear with the information! She's very knowledgeable about the topics she teaches, and everything is straight from the book. If you go to class, take good notes from the power point lecture, and read for the online quizzes and 3 tests, it's an easy class.

She is new to KSU and I would not recommend her. She is still using her lectures from her previous school that used a different book. Power Points are vague and her test questions are from her old school and her old book. You have no means of acquiring the information needed.

As a History Education major, I first thought that I would love this class, however, this professor is nice but useless when it comes to preparing students for the tests. She gets a bit on the annoying side and there are a few students, like myself, who regret taking this course. Many students dropped after the first few days and I wish I did too.

She's a really good lecturer but you have to pay attention in order to get everything. Just copying the PowerPoint won't cut it. Her tests have essays and are super detailed. You can't get by in her class without studying
